titles.title: Wilt Thou, O Man, Live Happily
Man, Wouldst Thou Live All Blissfully

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Wilt thou, O man, live happily, And dwell with God eternally, The ten commandments keep, for thus Our God Himself biddeth us. Kyr' eleison!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I am the Lord and God! take heed No other god doth thee mislead; Thy heart shall trust alone in Me, My kingdom then thou shalt be.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Honor My Name in word and deed, And call on Me in time of need: Hallow the Sabbath, that I may Work in thy heart on that day.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Obedient always, next to Me, To father and to mother be; Kill no man: even anger dread; Keep sacred thy marriage bed.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Steal not, nor do thy neighbor wrong By bearing witness with false tongue; Thy neighbor's wife desire thou not, Nor grudge him aught he hath got.
